question: Which rapper released the hit song 'Juicy' in 1994?
funFact: 'Juicy' was the first single from The Notorious B.I.G.'s debut album 'Ready to Die.' It is considered one of the greatest hip-hop songs of all time.

question: Which group released the album 'The Chronic' in 1992?
funFact: Dr. Dre's 'The Chronic' is known for popularizing the G-funk sound and is regarded as one of the most influential hip-hop albums.

question: Who is the artist behind the 1996 album 'All Eyez on Me'?
funFact: 'All Eyez on Me' was Tupac Shakur's fourth studio album and the first double album in hip-hop history.

question: What year did Nas release his debut album 'Illmatic'?
funFact: Nas's 'Illmatic' is often cited as one of the greatest hip-hop albums of all time and showcases his exceptional lyrical skill.

question: Which song is considered the breakout hit for the rapper Snoop Dogg?
funFact: Snoop Dogg's breakout came from his collaboration with Dr. Dre on 'Nuthin' But a 'G' Thang,' which was featured on 'The Chronic.'

question: Which group was known for the album 'Enter the Wu-Tang (36 Chambers)'?
funFact: Wu-Tang Clan's debut album 'Enter the Wu-Tang (36 Chambers)' is a landmark album in hip-hop history.

question: Who released the album 'Reasonable Doubt' in 1996?
funFact: 'Reasonable Doubt' is Jay-Z's debut album and is considered one of his best works.

question: Which 90s rapper was known for the hit song 'Hypnotize'?
funFact: 'Hypnotize' was a major hit for The Notorious B.I.G. and was released just weeks before his untimely death.

question: Who was the frontman of the group Public Enemy?
funFact: Chuck D is known for his powerful voice and politically charged lyrics as the leader of Public Enemy.

question: Which rapper's real name is Christopher Wallace?
funFact: Christopher Wallace, better known as The Notorious B.I.G., is considered one of the greatest rappers of all time.

question: Which group had a hit with the song 'Jump Around'?
funFact: 'Jump Around' by House of Pain is one of the most recognizable hip-hop songs of the 90s, known for its energetic beat.

question: Who was known for the song 'California Love'?
funFact: 'California Love' is a collaboration between Tupac Shakur and Dr. Dre, and it became one of Tupac's signature songs.

question: Which 1999 album by Dr. Dre is considered a sequel to 'The Chronic'?
funFact: Dr. Dre's '2001' is seen as a follow-up to his classic album 'The Chronic' and features many hits like 'Still D.R.E.' and 'Forgot About Dre.'

question: Who was the first solo rapper to win a Grammy Award for Best Rap Album?
funFact: Will Smith won the first Grammy Award for Best Rap Album in 1998 for 'Big Willie Style.'

question: Which rapper was part of the group Digital Underground before going solo?
funFact: Tupac Shakur was a dancer and rapper with Digital Underground before launching his successful solo career.

question: Which song did Coolio release in 1995 that became a massive hit?
D: C U When U Get There
funFact: 'Gangsta's Paradise' by Coolio was one of the biggest hits of the 90s and won a Grammy for Best Rap Solo Performance.

question: What was the name of Ice Cube's debut solo album released in 1990?
funFact: 'AmeriKKKa's Most Wanted' was Ice Cube's first solo album after leaving N.W.A. and is critically acclaimed for its powerful lyrics.

question: Which rapper was known as the 'Godfather of Gangsta Rap'?
funFact: Eazy-E, a member of N.W.A., is often referred to as the 'Godfather of Gangsta Rap' for his pioneering work in the genre.

question: Which song by The Notorious B.I.G. contains the lyrics 'It was all a dream, I used to read Word Up! magazine'?
funFact: The lyrics 'It was all a dream, I used to read Word Up! magazine' are from The Notorious B.I.G.'s iconic song 'Juicy.'
